intro: Odontadenia cognata, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine, silvery hair. Odontadenia cognata is adapted to arid environments and has a long flowering period, often blooming in spring and summer.
